text.p: Tropical cyclone Gavin is moving into the Fiji islands at this hour. Top winds near the center of Gavin are estimated at 130 mph. The hardest hit area will most likely be Vanua Levu. The northern coastline can expect a damaging storm surge along with strong and damaging winds. Most of the region can expect heavy rains leading to flooding and winds strong enough to cause damage. In addition the system will make for dangerous seas which will impact shipping in the area.

Tropical cyclone 32p has formed in the Coral Sea will east of Queensland Australia. Top winds are currently only 35 mph but they are expected to increase to 65 mph during the next 48-72 hours. This system is mostly a threat to shipping as it stays east of Australia during this period.
There are no further emergency statements at this time.
